DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Autologous Bone Marrow Or Stem Cell Transplantation With Anti-GD2 Administered Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/not applicable indicator that asks whether the patient has been without any other form of anti-GD2 antibody marrow/stem cell purging except autologous bone marrow or stem cell transplantations.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Autologous Bone Marrow Or Stem Cell Transplantation With Anti-GD2 Administered Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a therapeutic procedure involving administration of autologous bone marrow transplantation or stem cell transplantation with monoclonal antibody GD2 anti-idiotype vaccine as a determinant of eligibility for participation in a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Autologous Bone Marrow Transplantation Or Autologous Stem Cell Transplantation With Monoclonal Antibody GD2 Anti-Idiotype Vaccine Administered Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Bone marrow transfer in which the patient is his own donor.  Bone marrow is removed prior to bone marrow ablation treatment and then returned to reconstitute the hematopoietic system. Prior to reinfusion the bone marrow is often treated to purge it of residual tumor cells.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The transference of stem cells within the same individual.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:A class of vaccines that consist of anti-idiotype monoclonal antibodies against the tumor-associated antigen disialoganglioside GD2 with potential antineoplastic activity.  Vaccination with a monoclonal antibody GD2 anti-idiotype vaccine produces an immunoglobulin response against GD2 with subsequent destruction of GD2 positive tumor cells via antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (ADCC).  GD2 is overexpressed in melanoma, neuroblastoma, soft tissue sarcoma, and small cell carcinoma of the lung. (NCI04):The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Bone marrow transfer in which the patient is his own donor.  Bone marrow is removed prior to bone marrow ablation treatment and then returned to reconstitute the hematopoietic system. Prior to reinfusion the bone marrow is often treated to purge it of residual tumor cells.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Stem cell transfer or transplantation in which the patient is their own donor.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.

A class of vaccines that consist of anti-idiotype monoclonal antibodies against the tumor-associated antigen disialoganglioside GD2 with potential antineoplastic activity.  Vaccination with a monoclonal antibody GD2 anti-idiotype vaccine produces an immunoglobulin response against GD2 with subsequent destruction of GD2 positive tumor cells via antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (ADCC).  GD2 is overexpressed in melanoma, neuroblastoma, soft tissue sarcoma, and small cell carcinoma of the lung. (NCI04)
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient  been without any
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient  been without any other form of anti-GD2 antibody marrow/stem cell purging except autologous marrow/stem cell infusions purged by using monoclonal antibodies linked to beads?
